entry.title: Re: Checking the JSON file log
entry.content:
Hi @ISoma 

Thank you for your question.

This depends on a the solution you use. Below are possible scenarios depending on the use case.

If you are using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In Public Cloud, there is no standard Fiori app that allows you to directly view raw JSON file logs from the Launchpad.

However, here is what you can do instead

  1. Using the Application Log App (F4879)
    • You can view logs of background jobs, OData API calls, and integration processes.
    • However, the log is structured text, not raw JSON.
  2. When using message Monitoring Apps (for integrations via Communication Arrangements)
    • Message Monitoring (Message Dashboard)
    • Application Interface Framework , Monitoring and Error Handling (AIF)
    • These allow you to see payloads (XML/JSON) for failed/successful messages.
  3. If you use SAP Cloud ALM or SAP Integration Suite
    • If the JSON is part of an integration flow, you can monitor and view payloads in Integration Suite Ã  Monitor Message Processing.

If SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is in use

In Private Cloud, you can view raw payloads including JSON directly in the system because you have access to:

  • Transaction SLG1 (Application Log) --> to view detailed logs including payloads if enabled by the application.
  • Transaction SXMB_MONI (PI/XI monitoring) --> for checking XML/JSON payloads in middleware.
  • Transaction /AIF/ERR (Application Interface Framework) --> to view and reprocess messages including raw JSON or XML content.
  • Custom ABAP development --> you could create a custom Fiori app or report that reads the JSON logs from database tables (if stored) and displays them in Launchpad.

Happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SOAP WS-RM in CAP nod js project
entry.content:
Hello @Philip_Nell_1 

Good news,The Proof of Delivery, Update (B2B) SOAP service in S/4HANA Public Cloud does not require the WS-ReliableMessaging. Instead, it expects WS-Addressing, which is why including wsa: MessageID in Postman enabled it to work.

Hereâ€™s the recommended setup for your CAP (Node.js) service:

What you should send

  • wsa:MessageID (unique per call, e.g. a UUID)
  • wsa:Action (exact value from the WSDL)
  • wsa:To (service endpoint from your Communication Arrangement)
  • wsa:ReplyTo = http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing/anonymous
  • Use your Communication User (Basic auth) from the S/4 communication arrangement

Minimal Node.js example (using soap and uuid)

import soap from 'soap';

import { v4 as uuidv4 } from 'uuid';

 

const WSDL_URL = process.env.POD_WSDL_URL;      // from BTP Destination

const ENDPOINT = process.env.POD_ENDPOINT_URL;  // from Comm. Arrangement

const ACTION   = '...exact Action from your WSDL...';

 

const client = await soap.createClientAsync(WSDL_URL, { endpoint: ENDPOINT });

client.setSecurity(new soap.BasicAuthSecurity(process.env.S4_USER, process.env.S4_PASS));

 

const wsa = `

<wsa:MessageID xmlns:wsa="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">urn:uuid:${uuidv4()}</wsa:MessageID>

<wsa:Action xmlns:wsa="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">${ACTION}</wsa:Action>

<wsa:To xmlns:wsa="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">${ENDPOINT}</wsa:To>

<wsa:ReplyTo xmlns:wsa="http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing">

  <wsa:Address>http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing/anonymous</wsa:Address>

</wsa:ReplyTo>`;

client.addSoapHeader(wsa);

 

const req = { /* your PoD payload */ };

const [resp] = await client.ProofOfDeliveryUpdateRequest_InAsync(req);

Common gotchas

  • Make sure the WS-Addressing namespace is exactly: http://www.w3.org/2005/08/addressing.
  • Use the precise wsa: Action from the PoD WSDL (itâ€™s case-sensitive).
  • Read endpoint/user/password from a BTP Destination, not hard-coded

With kind regards

Chuma

 

 

GenAI Assisted Content (Useful references)

Proof of Delivery â€“ Update (B2B) SOAP service (API Hub): official service page for the PoD inbound SOAP youâ€™re calling

CAP tutorial â€“ Consume SOAP Web Services in CAP (Node.jsğŸ˜ step-by-step guide for wiring SOAP in a CAP Node.js service (basis for the sample code)

Example of WS-Addressing MessageID requirement in S/4HANA Cloud SOAP: SAP Help page for a product SOAP service that explicitly mandates a unique MessageID in the SOAP header (illustrates the WS-Addressing pattern many S/4 Cloud SOAP services use).

entry.title: Re: Getting '403' error accessing S/4 Public Cloud API fr...
entry.content:
Hello @diella 

Thanks for sharing the details of your setup, which helped a lot in narrowing down the issue. The 403 errors arenâ€™t random; they usually indicate one of two things.s:

  1. The API youâ€™re calling doesnâ€™t accept the authentication method youâ€™re using (OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion with user propagation),
  2. Or the business user/communication arrangement doesnâ€™t have the right authorisation or restrictions.

Hereâ€™s what applies to the specific services you mentioned:

  • API_PRODUCT_SRV â†’ Correct approach. Works with user propagation when you assign BR_PRODMASTER_SPECIALIST and maintain the communication arrangement SAP_COM_0009.
  • API_MATERIAL_STOCK_SRV â†’ Needs the communication arrangement SAP_COM_0164. Also, verify that your propagated user has the correct catalogues and that restrictions on Plants are maintained in IAM; otherwise, reads will still fail with a 403 error.
  • API_SALESORGANIZATION_SRV â†’ This one doesnâ€™t support SAML bearer at all. Documentation shows only BasicAuthentication or ClientCertificateAuthentication. In practice, youâ€™ll need to create a communication user and a second destination in BTP with Basic authentication to consume this API.

Why you can see $metadata in the browser but not from your UI5 app: your browser session runs under your full interactive login, while the app uses whatever is defined in the BTP destination. If the API doesnâ€™t allow SAML bearer, or if the propagated user doesnâ€™t meet the restriction checks, youâ€™ll encounter a 403.

Recommended next steps:

  1. Verify that you have active communication arrangements for each APIâ€™s scenario (0009, 0164, 0087).
  2. For Material Stock, add the missing restriction values such as Plant in IAM for your business role.
  3. For Sales Organisation, create a BasicAuth destination using a communication user â€” SAML bearer wonâ€™t work there.

That should unblock the services that are failing. 

Let me know if you need further support

Best regards,

Chuma

 

GenAI assistance content

SAP Usefull references

Verify that you have active communication arrangements for each APIâ€™s scenario 0009, 0164, 0087.
â€¢ Reference: Communication Arrangements â€“ SAP Help Portal

For Material Stock, add the missing restriction values, such as  Plant, in IAM for your business role.
â€¢ Reference: IAM Information System â€“ SAP Help Portal

For the Sales Organisation, create a BasicAuth destination with a communication user â€” SAML bearer authentication will not work there.

entry.title: Re: I need to use custom rap api in intgeration suite but...
entry.content:
Hello @yaswanth31102000 

The error occurs because Integration Suite canâ€™t fetch $metadata with the credentials or adapter youâ€™re using. Key points.

  • Use a Communication User from a Communication Arrangement (S/4 Public Cloud) or an OAuth client (ABAP Cloud/Steampunk). Your email login as a dialogue user will not work.
  • Ensure your RAP service is published in the Service Binding and that you copy the exact Service URL from it there.
  • Check that the adapter matches the binding:
    â€¢ RAP OData V2 â†’ use OData V2 adapter with Basic Auth (Comm. User).
    â€¢ RAP OData V4 â†’ use OData V4 adapter or HTTP adapter; V2 wizard wonâ€™t load V4 metadata.
  • Ensure you can open <service-URL>/$metadata in a browser using the communication user before setting up Integration Suite.

That should resolve the metadata load error.

Refer to the helpful documentation below

Communication Arrangements-SAP Help

Service Binding-SAP Help

OData Adapter-SAP Help

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Two fields using WITH_INTENT_BASED_NAVIGATION always...
entry.content:
Hello @Yanxing 

What youâ€™re observing is not a bug. Both links direct to Manage Journal Entries, but your annotations are sending identical parameter mappings to the target app. Assign each field its own unique mapping to ensure the target receives the correct keys.

What needs to be changed

Map each parameter of the target app, such as CompanyCode, FiscalYear, and AccountingDocument, individually for each column.

ABAP CDS (field-level mapping)

@UI.lineItem: [

  { type: #DATA_FIELD_FOR_INTENT_BASED_NAVIGATION,

    label: 'Accounting Doc',

    value: AccountingDocument,

    semanticObject: 'JournalEntry',

    semanticObjectAction: 'manage' }

]

@Consumption.semanticObject: 'JournalEntry'

@Consumption.semanticObjectAction: 'manage'

@Consumption.semanticObjectMapping.additionalBinding: [

  { element: 'CompanyCode',        localElement: 'CompanyCode'        },

  { element: 'FiscalYear',         localElement: 'FiscalYear'         },

  { element: 'AccountingDocument', localElement: 'AccountingDocument' }

]

AccountingDocument;

 

@UI.lineItem: [

  { type: #DATA_FIELD_FOR_INTENT_BASED_NAVIGATION,

    label: 'Reclass Doc',

    value: ReclassAccountingDocument,

    semanticObject: 'JournalEntry',

    semanticObjectAction: 'manage' }

]

@Consumption.semanticObject: 'JournalEntry'

@Consumption.semanticObjectAction: 'manage'

@Consumption.semanticObjectMapping.additionalBinding: [

  { element: 'CompanyCode',        localElement: 'CompanyCode'              },

  { element: 'FiscalYear',         localElement: 'FiscalYear'               },

  { element: 'AccountingDocument', localElement: 'ReclassAccountingDocument'}

]

ReclassAccountingDocument;

Important: For the second link, map the target AccountingDocument to your local ReclassAccountingDocument. If you have an entity-level mapping, either remove it or override it with these field-level bindings.

Quick checks

  • Both local properties are present in your projection view.
  • Company code and fiscal year are present within the row context.
  • Clear the cache and retest; check the URL hash to confirm the correct parameters are passed.

How to Set Up Outbound (Intent-Based) Navigation and When to Use the Demo Kit / Learning sapui5.hana.ondemand.com-Discover New Enterprise Grade Horizons       

SAP Learning-Configuring External Navigation

Common vocabulary, SemanticObjectMapping, what Mapping does and why each field needs its own mapping to pass the right parameters, sap.github.io

Manage Journal Entries (F0717), app reference, and KBA listing supported semantic objects for intent-based navigation. SAP Support Portal

With kind regards

Chuma Ofole

entry.title: Re: G/L Account Not Transported to Test System & Production
entry.content:
Hello @wangxlbest 

Thanks for the details. In S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, G/L accounts are master data and are not included in configuration transports. While setting the Implementation Status to Productive (P) is essential for postings, it does not transfer the account. To use the account in both Test and Production environments, you must create or mass-create it in each tenant using the delivered templates apps. SAP Help Portal

Recommended ways to replicate the account

Mass creates via Manage Operating Chart of Accounts â†’ Expert Worklist

    • Download the template, add the new account(s), upload, Complete Action, then Assign Company Codes. This is the fastest way to move several accounts between systems. SAP Help Portal

Create individually via Manage G/L Account Master Data (F0731A)

    • Create the account in each tenant, then set the Implementation Status to 'Productive' at both the CoA level and for each company code. SAP Support Portal-3567248 - 'Implementation Status' field in the App 'Manage G/L Account Master Data' post upgrade

Tip: Implementation Status indicates whether an account is active and modifiable; it acts as a governance flag, not a transport mechanism. SAP Help Portal

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Steps to fix the X-Frame-Options error to integrate a CAP application into Build workzone Launchpad
entry.content:
When attempting to configure a CAP application within the SAP Build Workzone launchpad service, you might encounter the following errors:
  1. "Refused to display 'XXX' in a frame because it set 'X - Frame - Options' to 'sameorigin'."
  2. "Embedding blocked because the allowlist or the allowlist service is not configured correctly - sap/ui/security/FrameOptions."
 
Here are the steps to resolve these issues:
 
Step 1: Modify the index.html file of the UI app
Insert the following lines:
<meta name="sap.whitelistService" content="./whitelist/service" />
data - sap - ui - frame - options="trusted"
 
Step 2: Configure the whitelist endpoint in xs-app.json
Add the following block:
"whitelistService": {
    "endpoint": "/whitelist/service"
}
 
Step 3: Set the CF environment variable CJ_PROTECT_WHITELIST using the CF command
Run the following command, replacing <YOUR_CAP_APP> with the actual name of your CAP application:
cf set - env <YOUR_CAP_APP> CJ_PROTECT_WHITELIST '[{"host":"*.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com"}]'
 
This should help in successfully integrating the CAP application into the SAP Build Workzone Launchpad and resolving the X - Frame - Options error.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Behaviour in SAP Cloud ALM Test Execution Analytics
entry.content:
Dear Customer,

In the Test Execution Analysis app, it displays the result for the Test Executions, but not the Test Cases.

As documented in the guide Test Execution Concepts:
Each instance of the test case (called an occurrence) corresponds to a specific test plan.
In addition, an extra occurrence per test case is also always available in the test plan group (None). 

It is an expected behavior that the test execution under Test Plan (None) is included in the Test Execution Analysis report.
You may use the filter 'Test Plan' to filter out the 'None' from the result in case needed. Please refer to the following KBA:

3554602 - Test cases appear in 'Test plan (None)' in Test Execution app 

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: Change user WO resp not possible batch wise anymore
entry.content:
Hi,

What app are you using for the mass person responsible change in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

I have just tested this with the 'Manage Maintenance Notifications and Orders' app, and mass edit works as expected. If yours doesn't, you may need to create a support ticket with some replication instructions.

Also, yes the default behaviour is that the update won't be allowed from a TECO status onwards. You should get an error message of "Status of order XXX does not allow changes".

I would recommend creating a customer influence request via the influence portal, then checking to see if other companies want this: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Asset Management 

There might also be other ways of handling it such as trying to tap into a 'team' via the invoice workflow instead of referencing a person responsible in the work order. You might need to activate some custom logic/BADi to do so, just depends on how much of a pain point this is / the frequency that this is happening: How to Configure the Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices 

Tim

Origin table

entry.title: Re: DataTable value not refreshing in SAP MDK
entry.content:
Add ClearData OnLoad Property

{
"_Type": "Section.Type.DataTable",
"Target": "/Application/Rules/ReturnData.js",
"DataPaging": {
"ShowLoadingIndicator": true,
"PageSize": 30
},
"_Name": "SectionDataTable0",
"ClearDataOnLoad": true, // Add this property
// ... rest of the configuration
}

entry.title: Re: Achieving Sustainability With SAP Asset Performance Management By Leveraging Industrial Systems.
entry.content:
Effective Data Management with PiLog DQG Suite 

Managing vast amounts of data across complex asset ecosystems can be a huge challenge for businesses today. PiLog Data Quality and Governance (DQG) Suite provides an alternative that is transformational in the nature that it rationalizes, standardizes, and automates data management. This suite is designed to assist the companies have an efficient control of their enterprise data, that is, convert it into a productive asset and not a failure.  

Why PiLog DQG Suite? 

The PiLog DQG Suite is a comprehensive framework that actively integrates AI-driven automation, industry-specific content and standards, and powerful governance protocols. This powerful combination ensures data integrity and operational excellence. 

 

 

Core Components of the Suite 

  • Autonomous AI Agents Framework: Smart automation that accelerates data transformation. 
  • iContent Foundry: A rich repository of 25 million Records with ISO standards and industry-specific content. 
  • Master Data Governance: Covers Assets, Spares, Services, Vendors, and Articles. 
  • Data Quality & Migration: Seamless migration from legacy systems (ECC, P6, IBM) toâ€¯SAP S/4HANAâ€¯(On-Premises, Public, and Private cloud). 

Industry-Relevant Asset Types 

Fromâ€¯drillsâ€¯andâ€¯boilersâ€¯toâ€¯railroad analysersâ€¯andâ€¯power grids, PiLog supports a wide range of Asset Types across sectors like: 

  • Mill Products 
  • Mining & Metals 
  • Chemicals 
  • Construction 
  • Petro-Chemicals 
  • Utilities 
  • Travel & Transportation 
  • Energy & Natural Resources 
  • Pharmaceuticals 
  • Public Sector 

Maturity Assessment & Roadmap 

PiLog  guides organizations through a structured Data Maturity journey: 

                       

 

 

Manual â†’ Digitized â†’ Standardized â†’ Optimized â†’ Autonomous 

  • Manual â†’ Data handled through spreadsheets and ad-hoc processes. 
  • Digitized â†’ Information moved into digital systems but still fragmented. 
  • Standardized â†’ Unified formats and taxonomies bring consistency across data. 
  • Optimized â†’ Data is governed, high-quality, and actively driving efficiency. 
  • Autonomous â†’ AI and automation enable self-correcting, self-managing data. 

This roadmap ensures that enterprises evolve their data practices in alignment with business goals and technological advancements. 

Data Transformation Process 

The suite follows a clear and effective transformation pipeline: 

 

 

Acquisition â†’ Cleansing & Classification â†’ Governance & AI Agents â†’ Replication to S/4 & SCM 

  • Acquisition â†’ Capturing data from diverse sources. 
  • Cleansing & Classification â†’ Removing errors and structuring with standard taxonomies. 
  • Governance & AI Agents â†’ Enforcing rules and enabling intelligent data management. 
  • Replication to S/4 & SCM â†’ Delivering trusted, ready-to-use data into SAP systems. 

This ensures that data is not only clean and standardized but also ready for real-time operational use. 

Master & Meta Data Content 

PiLog provides a comprehensive repository including: 

 

 

  • Standards â†’ PiLog's repository is built on established rules and guidelines that define the format and quality of the data. 
  • Taxonomy â†’ PiLog's content is organized using a hierarchical classification system for streamlined data management. 
  • OEM, OCM, OPM â†’ The repository includes vital data related to Original Equipment, Component, and Part Manufacturers. 
  • Repository â†’ PiLog provides a centralized location for storing and managing all master and metadata. 
  • Ready Reference â†’ All data within the PiLog repository is pre-validated and readily available for immediate use and reference. 

Supported Master Data Objects 

The suite manages a wide array of master data objects such as: 

  • Asset Equipment â†’ Centralized records for assets throughout their lifecycle. 
  • Functional Location â†’ Hierarchical mapping of where assets belong in operations. 
  • Work Center â†’ Defining the people, machines, and resources that perform tasks. 
  • BoMs (Bills of Materials) â†’ Structured details of components that make up equipment. 
  • Maintenance Strategy & Plans â†’ Standardized schedules and rules for asset upkeep. 
  • MRO Material & Services â†’ Streamlined data for spare parts, consumables, and vendor services. 
  • Failure Mode Library â†’ Catalog of potential failure scenarios to support reliability analysis. 
  • MP Industrial System Objects â†’ Representation of complex industrial systems in line with IEC/ISO standards. 

Seamless Integration 

With compatibility acrossâ€¯SAP API HUBâ€¯andâ€¯SAP Cloud ERP, PiLog ensures smooth integration into existing enterprise ecosystems. 

Transform Your Data, Transform Your Business 

Either mining, utilities or manufacturing, the PiLog DQG Suite has a scalable, driven, and transformation-ready data management approach. Being built on AI agents and industry specific content, it is finally high time to pull the lever towards autonomous excellence rather than a manual mechanism.

entry.title: SAP Field Service management crew functionality basic setup and learnings
entry.content:
INTRODUCTION:

This blog explores how Crew Management empowers dispatchers and technicians to deliver smarter, faster, and safer service through structured team execution. 

  • Inefficient task allocation leading to delays and resource mismanagement
  • Limited scalability to handle high volumes of service requests
  • Inconsistent skill matching affecting the quality of specialized tasks

To overcome operational inefficiencies we used this solution for executing the field teams operations which helped in Structured crew creation with designated leads and members for better accountability, Skill-based task assignment aligned with technician availability and expertise, Real-time schedule monitoring and adjustments improving responsiveness which helps the Dispatchers.

Getting Started: Prerequisites for SAP FSM Crew Management

To successfully enable and utilize the Crew Management feature in SAP Field Service Management, certain foundational elements must be in place:

  • Admin User Access: Required to configure crew settings, manage permissions, and control access across the system.
  • Service Technicians: Must be created with relevant skill profiles and assigned to appropriate regions to ensure accurate crew composition.
  • Dispatchers: Play a key role in planning, scheduling, and assigning tasks to crews based on availability and expertise.

Additionally, all essential master data including regions, customers, equipment, and service call types must be properly configured and aligned. This ensures smooth crew operations, accurate task assignments, and compliance with service protocols.

Enable Crew Functionality

  • Navigate to Settings and Configuration in SAP FSM.
  • Go to Planning and Dispatching.
  • Enable the Crew Management feature.

Create and Manage Crews

  • Use the Master Data Management (MDM) application to create crews.
  • Define crew leads and members.
  • Assign relevant skills and availability to each crew member.

Assign crew technicians for required dates: 1 lead & 1 member added for this case.

Assign Crews to Activities

  • In the Planning and Dispatching application:
    • Assign service calls or activities directly to crews.
    • Ensure that crew schedules align with appointment times.
  • A service call is created along with an activity, which is then assigned to a crew for execution.

Monitor and Adjust Crew Schedules

  • Use the Crew Planning View to:
    • Track crew availability.
    • Adjust crew composition and member roles as needed.
    • Monitor real-time progress and reassign tasks dynamically.

Setting up the view to display only crew, which will hide individual technicians:


Note: The customer, crew names and all the master data shown in the screenshots are for illustrative purposes only.

Implementation Highlights

The SAP FSM Crew Management helped dispatchers to restructure the technicians in field service operations. Crews were strategically formed based on task complexity and required skill sets, ensuring the right expertise was deployed for each job. Dispatchers used FSMâ€™s intuitive interface to dynamically allocate resources, monitor progress in real time, and respond swiftly to changing service demands.

Results Achieved

The implementation delivered measurable improvements across key performance areas: increase in task completion rate driven by better crew coordination and thanks to optimized scheduling and resource utilization allowing us to dynamically change the technicians based on the schedule and requirements, this also Improved efficiency through team-based protocols and structured execution and also Enhanced collaboration and skill development within crews sharing knowledge on the job.

Lessons Learned

  • Crew-based execution significantly boosts efficiency and service quality in field operations.
  • Real-time visibility into crew schedules is essential for managing dynamic workloads.
  • Crew Management in SAP Field Service Management (FSM) operates as a standalone planning and dispatching solution. It is not integrated with backend systems like SAP S/4HANA via the PACG connector, which currently supports only the legacy â€œTeamsâ€ functionality. As a result, all crew-related planning, scheduling, and execution must be managed exclusively within the FSM environment.

Conclusion

SAP FSM Crew Management proved to be a transformative solution for the utility company, enabling scalable field operations, improving service delivery, and reinforcing safety and efficiency. By aligning the right people with the right tasks at the right time, the company unlocked new levels of performance and agility in its service processes.

Importantly, SAP continues to invest in enhancing the Crew Management functionality, aiming to deliver greater value for both customers and FSM users. Future updates are expected to expand integration capabilities, improve usability, and support more advanced planning scenarios making Crew Management an even more powerful tool for field service excellence.  Updates for the same can be tracked in the official website (requires login) link with filter for crew: https://roadmaps.sap.com/board?CB=6EAE8B28C5D91ED8B4D1529625C9C0D2&q=crew&range=FIRST-LAST

 

 

Thanks

Best Regards,

Dhanush

entry.title: gCTS - Backup and Restore specific ABAP Object - Git
entry.content:
Using gCTS, the objects are backed up to the GitHub Repository.  If a specific object needs to be restored from Git to On-Premises System, there is no option for it in gCTS. 

It is possible to Push to Git Repository by TR/Package/Object specific. To restore, only 'Current Commit' and 'Last Repository Action' is available in gCTS. 

Purpose of restoring specific objects: If a specific Git Repo is used as backup option to Retire some ABAP Objects, in some case, the retired/deleted object specific to RICEFW may need to be restored. At that point, other Retired ABAP Objects is not needed for Restore. Only Selected-Specific objects needs to be Pulled to SAP System. 

How will I retore specific object? Any alternate way?

entry.title: Data Migration - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
entry.content:
This is only relevant for Partners and Live Customers who are required to transit Production system data with EUR adoption in Bulgaria. How To Guide Collection - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

In the 4th session offered by ASC Cloud ERP Expertise Services, the main topic covered is around Data Migration.

  • Recording - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Data Migration)
  • Presentation - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Data Migration)
  • Accelerator Guide - Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Data Migration)

Key Discussion Pointsâ€Œ

â€Œ1. Data Migration Strategyâ€Œ

  • Focus on currency conversion from BGN to EUR for impacted customers
  • Requires creation of new company code with EUR as local currency
  • Migration of relevant customer data to new company code

2.    Migration Process Overviewâ€Œ

  • Follows SAP Activate methodology phases:
  • Explore: Data migration strategy and requirements alignment
  • Realize: Data migration development and staging table preparation
  • Deploy: Cutover activities and go-live

â€Œ3. Technical Approachâ€Œ

  • Uses S/4HANA Migration Cockpit as primary tool
  • No automation available for public cloud (unlike private cloud)
  • Requires manual extraction â†’ transformation â†’ loading process
  • Supports over 200 standard migration objects

â€Œ4. Critical Considerationsâ€Œ

  • Close open transactional items pre-migration to minimize effort
  • Review master data and use mass maintenance apps where possible
  • Handle currency conversion for amount fields during transformation

5. Next Step

  • Review accelerator documents for object-specific migration guidance
  • Validate approach through development system testing
  • Schedule migrations during low-activity periods to minimize system impact

Live Questions & Answers

â€ŒTopic Areaâ€Œ

â€ŒQuestionâ€Œ

â€ŒAnswerâ€Œ

Employee

What about Employee Work Agreement? We use Business Partner data for expense payment and these needs to be switched to new CC as well. We load them via Interface from an external Tool (Workday)

Then it would be required to update the newly migrated cost centres and company codes in the external system and updating the worker in S/4HANA public cloud. This can not be covered via the data migration cockpit.  

History inventory movement

Would it be possible to migrate history inventory movements per material?

It is only possible to migrate the inventory balance, financial inventory balance as well as physical stock level, no movement history per material - Material inventory balance

GRIR Account Migration

How to handle historical goods receipts when invoices will be posted in new company code?

GR/IR (goods receipt / invoice receipt) accounts need to already be balanced by the migration key date (posting date). The MM - Purchase order (only open PO) migration object supports only open purchase orders, that is, items that haven't been delivered and invoiced yet. This means that there are no open items on the GR/IR clearing accounts at this point in time.

 

Down Payments

How to settle down payments against open POs in new company code?

When migrating the down payments made to suppliers first step is to replicate the payment request in the target company code using the app â€œManage Supplier Down Payment Requestsâ€ (F1688). Once they got replicated, next step is to clear them by using the app â€œClear outgoing Paymentsâ€ (F1367) against previously migrated accounts payable open items which should have been booked onto your AP migration offsetting account during the account payables open item migration process.

Others

Do you have similar guide for the EUR transition for ECC system and specially for IS-U system?

Unfortunately, we only focus on Public Cloud ERP. 

Here is what we known that has been published. (Contacts (mail) and way to proceed is documented)

Â·      Main note: 3196150 - Collective note for Euro changeover in Bulgaria - SAP for Me

Â·      If ERP system 316222 - Local currency changeover to target currency with SAP ERP Systems (ECC) - SAP for Me

Â·      If S/4 PCE/OP 3229024 - S/4HANA Currency Changeover - Central Note - SAP for Me

Additionally, our Globalization Services team also has available collaborative Workzone group for Bulgaria https://pages.community.sap.com/topics/localization/regional-collaboration

Please select the EUR Bulgaria and register. Approvals will be done by Globalization Services and usually soon.

This channel is often used by ECC/OP/PCE customers.

Call-to-Action

Register and Attend Upcoming Webinar presented by SAP Service experts with practical suggestions

  • Register Now [Sept 3rd] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Finance)
  • RegisterNow [Sept 24th] Bulgaria EUR Transition for Live Customers (Sales, Reporting, Q&A)
  • [Replay] Overview, IAM, Cutover Plan -Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live ...  
  • [Replay] Integration & Extensibility - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Cloud Live Customers
  • [Replay] Sourcing & Procurement - Bulgaria EUR Transition for S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Live Customers

Please view all content and raise questions with tag #Bulgaria

entry.title: Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt ğŸ”¨ğŸª™ ... COMING SOON
entry.content:
Welcome to the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt, a chase around important SAP developer-related tools/sites, a challenge to construct a secret phrase, and a chance to win 1000s of points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

The hunt officially starts Sept. 25, with the release of the first clue during that day's SAP Developer News, and you have until the end of Devtoberfest, Oct. 24, to complete it.

To get all the clues make sure to SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

Learn more about the  entire Devtoberfest event in @KevinR's post Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!.

What you need to find

We have hidden a special phrase, which you need to figure out using the clues in the next section. Along your journey you will do the following:

  1. Visit about 10 different locations related to SAP developers, mostly web sites that are designed to help you in your daily SAP development.
  2. At each location, you will discover a set of hexadecimal digits.
  3. Concatenate the digits together (in the order of the missions) to get one, 37-digit hexadecimal number.
  4. Multiply that hexadecimal number by another secret number, for which we will give a clue.
  5. Take the resulting 38-digit hexadecimal product, and convert it into the secret phrase, using each pair of digits as ASCII characters.
  6. Enter the phrase, exactly (case-sensitive, no extra spaces), into the Scavenger Hunt tutorial.â€Œ

Not until the SAP Developer News of Oct. 16 will you have all the pieces to be able to complete the phrase. 

Example Mission

As an example of what you will have to do, here's a short sample mission (just a warm-up, no points will be earned).

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
17

SAP Developers YouTube Channel

Go to our SAP Developer YouTube channel. 

Open @Rekha_DR's video "SAP Build Process Automation (Part 1): Build your very first process". Watch it and find the secret 7-digit hexadecimal number in one of the info cards.

26SAP Community

Use the Developer Tools on your browser to inspect the words "SAP Community" in the previous column and find the 6-digit ASCII code for the color of the text.

 

3None (directly) 

Concatenate the 2 sets of hexadecimal digits, in order, and multiply the resulting hexadecimal number by the number of original SAP founders (you can easily find the number on the SAP Wikipedia page).

Convert the resulting hexadecimal number into a phrase, converting each pair of digits into a character using ASCII codes.

ğŸ‘‰Post a comment/picture about the phrase -- but NOT the phrase itself  (like your experiences with or opinion about the phrase, or a picture of something belonging to you that reminds you of the phrase) -- you won't get any points, but it will be fun and you will be ready for the real scavenger hunt. If you have any trouble with this example mission, post in the comments.

REMINDER: The above is just an example of how the real scavenger hunt will work. The real scavenger hunt instructions will be described in the rest of this blog post, as clues become available.

 

The (real) mission

Below are the instructions for finding the hexadecimal digits for the actual scavenger hunt. We will release clues as follows:

  • In the SAP Developer News of Sept. 25, Oct. 2, Oct. 9, and Oct. 16.
  • In this blog each Monday during the first 3 weeks of Devtoberfest.

ğŸ‘‰To be notified when a new clue is released, SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

â€Œ When you find the secret phase, just enter it into this Devtoberfest tutorial.

To guide you, we have created a second tutorial -- you do not have to use it, nor do you get any points from it. But you can enter the 1 to 6 digits from each mission to check if you received the correct digits for that mission.

Here are your missions:

 

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
12

SAP Developer News

The Developer News comes out each Thursday with the latest about ABAP, CAP, BTP, SAP Build, UI5, Fiori, AI, and all your favorite SAP developer topics. All delivered by some of your favorite Developer Advocates, like DJ, Shilpa Shankar, Thomas Jung, Antonio Maradiaga, Nora von Thenen and the rest of the gang.

Most episodes about 5 minutes. Also available as a Podcast.

Watch the Developer News of Sept. 25
26 To be released Sept. 29
34 To be released Sept. 29
42 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 2
54 To be released Oct. 6
66 To be released Oct. 6
76 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 9
86 To be released Oct. 13
91 To be released Oct. 13
10None (directly) Watch the Developer News of Oct. 16

Good luck!

entry.title: Re: how to create a workflow for the diary ledger
entry.content:
Hi @yahaha 

in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, approval workflows for journal entries are supported through flexible workflow.

  1. Here is the App you can use
  • Use the Manage Workflows for Journal Entry Verification app. This app lets you define approval workflows for parked journal entries before they are posted.
  1. The following steps will guide you on how you can set it up
  1. Activating the desired Workflow
    • Open Manage Your Solution or CBC.
    • Scope item 1GA â€“ J59 which is the Journal Entry Verification must be activated.
  2. Configuring the desired Workflow
    • Go to Manage Workflows for Journal Entry Verification app.
    • Create a new workflow scenario. Then define the following:
      • Start conditions for example company code, document type, amount. Then define the Step sequence. Thereafter, the approver determination for example role, user, organizational unit must be defined.
  3. You can carry out Testing as follows
    • Post a journal entry via Post General Journal Entries app but select Park. The entry will trigger the workflow. Then approvers will receive tasks in My Inbox app where they can approve or reject.
  4. Once approval is completed, the system will automatically post the journal entry.

References:

Journal Entry Verification Workflow

Manage Workflows for Journal Entry Verification

I hope this provides the right guidance. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: ATP vs Advanced ATP in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private edition 2023
entry.content:
Introduction

Choosing between ATP and Advanced ATP is a crucial decision for organizations seeking future-proof functionality. This guide outlines the key considerations for making the right choice and clarifies the limitations and future roadmap of each platform.

Understanding the Platforms

  • ATP (Advanced To Promise): ATP has served as a robust tool for threat detection and response. However, it is important to note that ATP will not be enhanced with new features going forward. Its existing capabilities will be maintained, but no future innovation.
  • Advanced ATP: Advanced ATP is designed with expanded functionality, incorporating more sophisticated threat analytics and response mechanisms. It benefits from ongoing development and regular introduction of new features to address emerging business challenges.

Key Differences

  • Feature Development: ATP will not receive additional features, while Advanced ATP will continue to evolve with new capabilities.
  • Integration: It is not possible to combine ATP and Advanced ATP functionalities. Each platform operates independently, and use of features from one cannot be merged with the other.

Advanced ATP functionalities

Product Availability Check (PAC)

  • It is possible to configure detailed verification scopes based on specific requirements or quantities.
  • Correlation of Schedule Line quantities in Sales Bill of Material
  • Zero Confirmation or full confirmation at End of Replenishment Lead Time by the configuration

Back Order Processing (BOP)

  • Configuration also enables the extension of prioritization capabilities, allowing users to tailor priority rules according to specific business requirements. By leveraging configurable settings, organizations can dynamically adjust how orders are prioritized during availability checks, ensuring that critical shipments or key customers receive preferential allocation when supply is limited.

Interactive Backorer Processing

  • User can manually change the strategy.

Business Process Scheduling (BPS)

  • Scheduling activities can be incorporated to enable comprehensive planning and management of timelines, allowing users to coordinate and optimize schedules effectively within the system.

Product Allocation Check (PAL)

  • A supply limit function enables users to define maximum available quantities, and configuration values can be conveniently uploaded directly from Excel files for efficient mass updates.

Supply Protection (SUP)

  • It is possible to set minimum supply limits.

Alternative Based Confirmation (ABC)

  • When product shortages occur, the system can automatically switch plants or substitute products based on pre-configured master data settings, ensuring that customer demands are fulfilled as efficiently as possible. This automated substitution functionality enhances flexibility and responsiveness by automatically identifying alternative supply sources or equivalent products, aligning with customer requirements even in the face of inventory constraints.

Dynamic third-party order processing

  • Triggering of third-party order processing (TPOP), where the requirement for ordered goods in a sales order are passed to a vendor (supplier) for direct shipment to the end customer.

ATP Analysis

  • First increment of an improved user experience when reviewing the availability check result in sales order processing:
  • SAP Fiori user experience (UX)
  • Cross-item overview on availability check result
  • Display confirmations including substitutes
  • Navigation to classic delivery proposal screen for non-subitem confirmations to allow proposal adjustments

Interactive ATP

  • With Review Availability Check Results (RACR), users have the ability to manually adjust the confirmed quantities as needed. This feature enables greater control and flexibility in managing order fulfillment, allowing adjustments to be made directly within the system based on changing supply conditions or operational requirements.

Supply creation-Based Confirmation (SBC)

  • In integration scenarios with PP-DS, support is provided for both Characteristics-Dependent Planning (CDP) and Support Block Planning within PP/DS, enabling sophisticated planning capabilities based on product characteristics and optimized scheduling through block planning methods.

Release for delivery (RefDy)

  • It is possible to manually adjust the allocated confirmed quantity during the creation of delivery documents, providing additional flexibility in the shipping process.

Advanced ATP Online help:

ATP Functionalities

Product Availability Check

  • Basic Product Availability check
  • Manually selection product
  • Manually plant selection changing
  • Simple transportation and shipment scheduling based on days (and hours)

Back Order Processing

  • Basic Backorder processing.
  • The available prioritization options are quite limited, restricted mainly to dates and shipping priority, and cannot be extended beyond these parameters.

ATP Online Help:

How to Choose

  • If your organization requires only the current feature set and stability, ATP may be sufficient. However, be aware that there will be no further feature enhancements.
  • If your organization needs advanced features and the flexibility to adapt to new threats, Advanced ATP is the recommended choice. Its ongoing development ensures access to the latest tools.
  • Consider your long-term strategy. For organizations aiming for future scalability and innovation, Advanced ATP will be more appropriate.
  • Advanced ATP requires an additional license beyond S/4HANA. Please contact your our sales guys about the detail.

Limitations

  • You cannot use ATP and Advanced ATP functionalities together. Selection of one platform means you rely exclusively on its feature set.
  • Migrating from ATP to Advanced ATP may require reconfiguration, so plan the transition carefully if you anticipate future needs for newer features.

Conclusion

When deciding between ATP and Advanced ATP, assess your organizationâ€™s future goals. If long-term growth and adaptability to new threats are priorities, Advanced ATP is the optimal selection. For static requirements with no need for new functionalities, ATP remains a viable, though limited, option. The inability to combine both platformsâ€™ features underscores the importance of a clear, strategic choice.

 

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA Customer Care and RIG

entry.title: Re: How to Define Posting Rules-Period Selection fieldï¼Ÿ
entry.content:
Navigate to the Rule Group: Go to your consolidation environment and find the transaction for maintaining Rule Groups (e.g., often found under Consolidation Settings > Rules for Automatic Postings > Manage Rules for Automatic Postings > How to Define Rule Groups).

Select Your Rule Group: Find and open the Rule Group that contains your posting rule Z99.

Check the "Processing Mode" Field: In the Rule Group configuration, there will be a key field called Processing Mode or similar. This field must be set to YTD - Year to Date.

Save the Change: Save the updated Rule Group

entry.title: Re: Mass Changes to Projects app: available statuses to c...
entry.content:
Hi @Egorov_Evgeny 

According to KBA 2903679, there is no customer project or internal project displayed in app "Mass Changes to project". Community discussions have raised this question, but so far, SAP Help and Fiori Apps Reference Library do not explicitly provide such a status list; restrictions might depend on business rules, project profiles, or current processing status like locked, closed, or technically completed.

In practice, some statuses such as "Closed," "Technically Completed" may not allow changes via mass operations, but official SAP Help materials recommend testing status changes directly in the app or consulting with SAP Support if you encounter restrictions.

Best regards

Chris
